content.user_title: Learn Claude Code skill structure with examples
content.value_statement: Creating your first Claude Code skill can be confusing without guidance. This template demonstrates the correct structure and principles for building effective skills.
actual_capabilities: Explains the structure of SKILL.md files
Provides three essential principles for skill development
Demonstrates intake question patterns for user interaction
Offers troubleshooting guidance for common skill issues
limitations: Does not execute code or perform automated actions
Cannot create or modify skills automatically
Provides guidance only without hands-on implementation

output_examples.input: What is a Claude Code skill?
output: A Claude Code skill is a structured capability defined in a SKILL.md file
It contains frontmatter metadata, essential principles, and intake questions
Skills help Claude understand how to assist with specific tasks

output_examples.input: What are the key principles for building skills?
output: Keep it simple: Start with minimum viable skill and add complexity only when needed
Test early: Verify your skill works after each change
Iterate: Improve based on actual usage and feedback

best_practices: Start with a minimal SKILL.md and add complexity only when needed.
Test your skill after each modification to catch issues early.
Write clear intake questions that guide users to available capabilities.
anti_patterns: Adding complex features before understanding basic skill structure.
Deploying a skill without testing it in Claude Code first.
Creating skills without clear purpose or documented principles.

faq.question: What platforms support this skill?
faq.answer: This template works with Claude, Codex, and Claude Code platforms.

faq.question: Does this skill access my files or data?
faq.answer: No. This is documentation only. It contains static text and does not access any files or data.

faq.question: Can I use this as a base for my own skill?
faq.answer: Yes. Copy the structure and replace the content with your own principles and intake questions.

faq.question: Why is my skill not loading?
faq.answer: Check that your SKILL.md has valid frontmatter with name and description fields at the top.

faq.question: How detailed should my skill principles be?
faq.answer: Start with 2-3 clear principles. Add more only if users need additional guidance.

faq.question: What makes a good intake question?
faq.answer: Good intake questions offer clear choices that map to distinct skill capabilities.
